text: LARSON CALLS FOR AWARENESS OF SHAKEN BABY SYNDROME
label: BODY

text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: April 3, 2001
label: BODY

text: LARSON CALLS FOR AWARENESS OF SHAKEN BABY SYNDROME
label: BODY

text: WASHINGTON, D.C.—U.S. Congressman John B. Larson (CT-01) today voted to designate the last full week of this month
label: BODY

text: as “National Shaken Baby Syndrome Awareness Week,” as part of National Child Abuse Prevention Month. The resolution
label: BODY

text: passed the House this afternoon.
label: BODY

text: This measure, H.Con.Res. 59, expresses the sense of Congress that National Shaken Baby Syndrome (SBS)
label: BODY

text: Awareness Week should be established to raise awareness regarding the syndrome. The resolution also urged that the
label: BODY

text: President issue a proclamation urging the public to observe this week with appropriate programs and activities.
label: BODY

text: “Children are completely defenseless, and are totally dependent on adults to care for them in every way, but far too often
label: BODY

text: someone who is charged with their care, and their lives, hurts or kills babies by shaking them,” said Larson. “Parents and
label: BODY

text: caregivers must be aware that a baby’s brain is incredibly fragile, and that shaking a baby in a single moment of selfish
label: BODY

text: frustration could lead to their permanent injury, or death. If an awareness week saves even one life, or prevents even
label: BODY

text: one injury, then it is very much worth all of our effort.”
label: BODY

text: SBS is a serious brain injury that often occurs when a frustrated caregiver “shakes” a child, usually to stop them from
label: BODY

text: crying. Veins, on and within the child’s brain, tear and bleed due to this shaking motion that then causes pressure on the
label: BODY

text: brain that leads to the destruction of brain tissue. The damaged brain then begins to swell which pushes down on the
label: BODY

text: brainstem that controls vital functions such as heart rate and breathing. If the swelling and pressure is not stopped, the
label: BODY

text: child will die. Symptoms range from mild forms of irritability, vomiting, breathing difficulties, to seizures and death. Twenty
label: BODY

text: Five to 30 percent of SBS victims die because of their injuries, while survivors suffer from one or more impairments
label: BODY

text: including permanent brain damage, deafness, and severe learning and behavioral problems. A sizeable number of
label: BODY

text: Americans remain unaware of SBS, which necessitates further education and discussion.
label: BODY
